ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I knew very little about Ancient Egypt going into this class, and it provided me with both an overview of Ancient Egyptian history and a nuanced way of analyzing that history. Professor Zhang emphasized contrasting the opinions of different egyptologists and scholars of gender studies, which taught me more about how to synthesize and evaluate the work in fields of study with which I was previously unfamiliar.
I gained more knowledge on women and gender in ancient Egypt. I came in knowing barely information on the topic and left with a vast knowledge of material.
I learned a lot about history in ancient egypt

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: We looked at a wide range of opinions on analyzing gender in Ancient Egypt, and the class presented the issue as a constantly changing and highly complex one. Prof Zhang didn't oversimplify things or endorse a certain view, which I really appreciated. The purely historical/chronological lectures took up a lot of class time, and while they were interesting, they covered a lot of information so quickly that I don't know if I held onto much of it.
I enjoyed the discussion style of the class, however I wish it was not solely based on the readings. I would have liked if we incorporated more videos and in-class activities.
i wish there was more focus in gender and identity versus learning history
i loved having lingxin as a professor! she was amazing and really cared about the subject matter as well as her students

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend it to anyone interested in ancient history, archaeology, and/or gender studies. It was a fascinating class to take and I always liked doing the readings.
Yes, I think the interesting material as well as the great professor makes this course recommendable
I would! I learned a lot about ancient egypt, Professor Zhang made lessons interesting
